oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reduced cardiac functional capacity as a consequence of the double-muscled conformation selection in the Belgian White and Blue breed
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Amory, H.
Rollin, F.
Lomba, F.
Desmecht, D.
Linden, A.
Lekeux, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cardiac insufficiency
cardiovascular system
heart
muscular hypertrophy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this hemodynamic study (conducted in 2 parts), cardiac function has been compared in double-muscled calves and in calves with conventional conformation. Simultaneous measurements of cardiac output, cardiovascular pressures and ventricular volumes showed that in the bovine species, the double-muscled conformation selection induces a significant reduction of the cardiac output and the stroke volume. This reduction in global cardiac performance is not due to a lower heart rate, a lower ventricular preload or an higher after load, but was rather associated with a reduced myocardial contractility and a lower indexed volumetric capacity.
